day at selected times <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in hours past <math alttext="12"><semantics><mn>12</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> midnight. A sinusoidal regression model <math alttext="y equals a sin open parentheses b t plus c close parentheses plus d"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>b</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is calculated using all five data points, where time <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the input value and temperature <math alttext="y"><semantics><mi>y</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the output value. Based on the regression model, which of the following is the best choice for the amplitude of the sinusoidal function?

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
